place.name: STANTON BY BRIDGE
place.gazetteerText: STANTON-BY-BRIDGE, a parish in Shardlow district, Derbyshire; 4½ miles E by S of Willington r. station, and 6 S by E of Derby. It has a post-office under Derby. Acres, 1,770. Real property, £2,013. Pop., 185. Houses, 36. The manor belongs to Sir J. H. Crewe, Bart., and Sir R. Burdett, Bart. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lichfield. Value, £345.* Patron, Sir J. H. Crewe, Bart. The church was restored in 1866. Charities for this parish and Shuttington, £287. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
